blocks.text: Hardware vulnerabilities affect physical components such as processors, firmware, and peripheral devices. Unlike software flaws, they may persist even after operating systems are reinstalled.
Firmware-level attacks can embed malicious code in devices that load before the operating system, allowing attackers to maintain long-term persistence.
Hardware vulnerabilities can also arise from design flaws in chip architectures that allow unintended data leakage across security boundaries.
Mitigation may require firmware updates, hardware replacement, or architectural changes, making remediation slow and costly.
